amendment.description: Amendment deletes language that prohibits or limits the Environmental Protection Agency's ability to promulgate, enforce, implement, or take certain actions authorized under environmental laws, including the Clean Air Act, Clean Water Act, and food safety laws. \ Amendment subsequently failed on a separate vote in the full House. See Roll Call No. 605.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 66 in the Congressional Record of July 26, 1995, to strike the provisions of the bill that prohibit or restrict the ability of the Environmental Protection Agency to enforce actions authorized under existing environmental laws.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Stokes amendment (A019) Agreed to by recorded vote: 212 - 206 (Roll no. 599).

action.text: Mr. Lewis (CA) demanded a separate vote on the Stokes amendment (A019).

vote.text: On agreeing to the Stokes amendment (A019) Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 210 - 210 (Roll no. 605).
